results.title: Digital Marketing Specialist
results.description:
Richardson is seeking a Digital Marketing Specialist to support our corporate marketing strategy by expanding overall digital presence.  Based in Philadelphia, the Digital Marketing Specialist will report to the Director of Digital Marketing and focus on executing daily SEO and SEM tasks, including paid search campaign management and optimization, digital content strategy ideation and implementation, organic search optimization, and reporting.

In addition to their regular responsibilities, the Digital Marketing  Specialist will have the opportunity to provide important contributions to strategic projects.

 

We are looking for a dynamic, organized, self-motivated individual with a strong understanding of SEO/SEM strategy and implementation. Ideally, the candidate will have a minimum 2 years of hands-on experience in web content management, paid search campaign management, writing and editing for the web, and digital marketing reporting.

Essential functions of the position:

  • Collaborate with agency partners, the Director of Digital Marketing, and the Richardson marketing team to develop and manage global SEM campaigns promoting Richardson’s brand, content and solutions.
  • Support implementation of Richardson’s global Digital Marketing Strategy by collaborating with agency partners, the Director of Digital Marketing, and the marketing team to support organic search strategy (SEO) by developing and optimizing web content.
  • Research trends in digital marketing, sales performance improvement, and B2B marketing strategy and provide insights and ideas for growth.
  • Continuously maintain and update Richardson’s website. Including, but not limited to building out new pages for weekly campaigns and product launches and publishing thought leadership and blog content.
  • Provide regular reporting and analysis of digital marketing performance.

Specific Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with agency partners, the Director of Digital Marketing, and the marketing team to help define, manage, and improve paid search strategy.
  • Work closely with agency partners, the Director of Digital Marketing, and the marketing team to create SEM (paid search, paid social, display, and remarketing) campaigns to promote Richardson’s solutions, content, events, and general branding/awareness.
  • Ensure the deployment of successful creative testing, bidding strategies, keyword management, and program expansion such that KPIs are met on time and within budget.
  • Monitor and evaluate performance across the major search channels to improve rankings and visibility and drive demand.
  • Collaborate with agency partners and the Director of Digital Marketing to conduct keyword research to optimize existing content and uncover new opportunities
  • Collaborate with digital marketing agency partners to audit the website for technical SEO performance and manage implementation of required corrective actions or changes to optimize website structure and the user experience
  • Provide recommendations and execute/manage strategies for content development in coordination with organic search goals.
  • Collaborate with agency partners and the Director of Digital Marketing to monitor and evaluate web analytics and build reports to evaluate organic search performance and identify opportunities for growth.
  • Support website related marketing technology stack improvements.
  • Create and send emails promoting weekly campaigns and thought leadership to our blog subscribers.
  • Support website user experience improvement strategy including A/B testing and reporting, and website performance.
  • Regularly update, create, and publish optimized content that meets brand standards.
  • Support and collaborate on website improvement projects.
  • Manage execution of tasks to ensure compliance with technical SEO best practices.
  • Other duties as requested by Marketing Management

 

Position Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Digital Marketing, Communications, Business, or related major
  • Minimum of 2 years’ professional experience in comprehensive paid search campaign management and organic search optimization (SEO)
  • Minimum of 2 years’ experience using AdWords, Google Analytics and Google Search Console, experience using additional Google products and Microsoft digital products is a plus
  • Experience working with multiple internal stakeholders across functional teams
  • Experience creating and presenting reports using data
  • Proficiency using Microsoft Office programs including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
  • B2B experience preferred
  • Experience publishing website content using a content management system is preferred
  • Experience using third party digital marketing tools to monitor and report on performance is a plus
  • Graphic design and video creation capabilities are not required, but are a plus

results.title: Product Marketing Director
results.description:
Gencove is a rapidly-growing startup developing a genome sequencing and analytics platform to enable the next generation of genomics applications in medicine and agriculture. We are revenue-generating with customers across the world, including leading genomics companies like BGI and universities like Stanford and the Weizmann Institute. We are looking for an experienced Product Marketing Director to join us and drive commercial adoption.

Reporting directly to Gencove’s CEO, you will be responsible for positioning Gencove's current and future products; continuously evaluating our product marketing strategy in a rapidly-changing environment; and working with the executive team to identify new business opportunities for Gencove’s low-pass sequencing platform.


Requirements

About you:

  • Experience in B2B product marketing
  • Experience working as part of an early-stage startup: you’re ready to build sales collateral for different classes of customer, get creative in reaching target markets, and roll up your sleeves and do what it takes to make the organization successful.
  • Familiar with the key companies and technologies used in genomics.
  • Proficiency with marketing automation and CRM systems.
  • Excellent communication/presentation skills and ability to build relationships
  • Enthusiastic and passionate

Responsibilities

  • Develop product positioning and messaging informed by user research, market insights, and product understanding.
  • Write website copy and customer emails, create sales narratives and assets, and report on product feedback to inform product development
  • Create and execute launch plans including market segmentation, value proposition, and competitive analysis.
  • Participate in brainstorming, office activities, staff meetings and client meetings, researching and assisting with program development for existing clients and new prospects
  • Participate in analysis of market trends, customer requirements, and competitive strategy, and in the identification of opportunities for increasing customer and business value through product differentiation

Benefits

Why Gencove:

  • We are a fast growing team and the product and the company’s needs will change, so your role will also evolve with time — with a sharp eye towards your professional development and personal satisfaction.
  • We are a fully distributed company driven by deliverables, not hours, operating with a foundation of trust and clear communication to solve meaningful scientific and business challenges.
  • We celebrate individuality and invest in bringing everyone together regularly at our HQ in NYC because we believe there is no substitute for real-life connection.
  • Competitive salary and stock options.
  • Flexible PTO plus the days between Christmas and New Year’s Day are company-wide time off; we actually do take time to disconnect, recharge, travel, and live our lives so we encourage you to do the same!
  • 3 months paid parental leave with flexibility to allocate however works best for you.
  • Comprehensive health coverage (medical, dental, vision and life) for you and your family.
  • $1,000 USD home office stipend to upgrade or enhance your work from home setup.

results.title: Head of Growth & Digital Marketing
results.description:
Who we are:

Sardine helps fintech, crypto, and web3 companies "move money confidently" by developing fraud, compliance, and payment infrastructure. With Sardine, builders can focus on growing their business instead of spending time, fighting against fraudsters. We're growing incredibly fast and powering over 100 customers around the world, like Brex, MoonPay, Bakkt, Luno, Transak, Chippercash, Candy Digital, Metamask, Brave, and RelayFi.

Our culture:

  • We have hubs in Bay Area, NYC, and Toronto. However, we have a remote-first work culture. #WorkFromAnywhere

  • We hire talented, self-motivated people and get out of their way

  • We value performance, not hours worked (or what time you work). We believe you shouldn't have to miss your family dinner, your kid's school play, or doctor's appointment for the sake of adhering to an arbitrary work schedule


Location:

  • US (From Home / Beach / Mountain / Cafe / Anywhere!)

  • We are a remote-first company with a globally distributed team. So you can find your productive zone and work from there

About the Role:

The Head of Growth & Digital Marketing will be responsible for planning, building, and managing marketing campaigns that drive awareness, demand, pipeline, and sales. You will work closely with cross-functional teams (Product, Sales, Business Operations) to develop and execute a marketing program across all owned and purchased channels. 

You'll need to have experience in B2B marketing and take an analytical approach to test, measure, and scale campaigns across multiple product lines. This role will support design, PR, content distribution, and social media efforts outside growth and demand generation. This role will also play a huge role in quarterbacking product marketing efforts and in building and managing marketing collateral across multiple product lines.

You will:

  • Manage the development of strategic, multi-prong marketing plans to support company-wide initiatives across three different product lines.

  • Create and maintain the marketing budget, owning the allocation of resources towards demand generation,  media channels, events, vendors, etc.

  • Manage all of the marketing operations and analytics reporting from all marketing activities

  • Support the management and performance of the website, which includes: copy updates, blog CMS, inbound marketing, etc.

  • Be a liaison between Product, Sales, and Business Operations to build and manage marketing collateral across all lines of business for sales enablement and customer retention purposes.

  • Manage event sponsorships and client events, booth planning and logistics, and ROI reporting

  • Lead email marketing for inbound and outbound and support the Account Management team for customer announcements.

  • Develop content ideas and lead distribution for branded content, including articles, blogs, website copy, social media posts, marketing campaigns, newsletters, and press releases.

An ideal candidate has:

  • You can flourish in a fast-paced, dynamic, entrepreneurial environment.

  • You prefer to build processes and aren't afraid to lead without a clear set of rules.

  • You have heavy fintech or fraud experience and are a Crypto/web3 enthusiast.

  • You are a HubSpot expert!

  • You have managed CMS and website development

  • You're a natural writer. You find it easy to create concise, intelligent, and highly readable content that will relate to your target audience.

  • You have superb time management skills and the ability to prioritize workload and manage deadlines.

Benefits we offer:

  • Generous compensation in cash and equity

  • 7-year for post-termination option exercise (vs. standard 90 days)

  • Early exercise for all options, including pre-vested

  • Work from anywhere: Remote-first Culture

  • Unlimited paid time off and minimum 2 weeks/year of mandatory vacation

  • Company-wide offsites, the last one was at Miami

  • MacBook Pro delivered to your door

  • One-time stipend to set up a home office — desk, monitors, etc.

  • Monthly meal stipend

  • Monthly health and wellness stipend

  • Monthly meet-up stipend

  • Unlimited access to an expert financial advisory


Join a fast-growing company with world-class professionals from around the world. If you are seeking a meaningful career, you found the right place, and we would love to hear from you.

results.title: Senior Product Marketer
results.description:
About Pragma

Pragma is supporting healthy and vibrant online communities by creating a backend game engine— a platform of services and tools that enable game studios to launch live-service games.

You'll be joining a passionate team that has scaled games such as League of Legends and Destiny 2 at studios like PopCap, Riot, Bungie, and EA. We have also scaled platforms at traditional tech companies including Google, Amazon, Unity, Microsoft,  SendGrid and Tableau. We are grateful to partner with top-notch investors including Greylock, Upfront Ventures, & Insight Partners as well as angels such as the founders of Oculus, Twitch, and Zynga.

About the Role
The Director of Marketing will report to the CEO and will play a vital role in ensuring rapid and sustainable growth. The Director of Marketing will oversee our overall marketing strategy across all marketing initiatives, acquisition channels, and distribution channels. The Director of Marketing will be the first marketing hire and be responsible for a breadth of responsibilities including press, brand, inbound and outbound marketing, and managing a rich content pipeline. We expect this individual to be a self-starter that can bring creative ideas and be passionate about marketing to a technically oriented game developer.

Responsibilities

  • Coordinate with the engineers, tech writing team to post, schedule, and strategize on technical content such as demos, videos, workshops, tutorials, technical white papers, conference presentations, webinars

  • Collaborate with customers and product teams to create case studies that grab the attention of game studios and developers

  • Produce newsletters to prospective customers on new features

  • Showcase the capabilities of Pragma

  • Represent Pragma at customer engagements such as with sales, at conferences, and at community and customer meetups

  • Work with sales team on enablement materials 

  • Work with sales and product team on product marketing

  • Come up with ideas for brand building

  • Work with press and manage speaking engagements

Qualifications

  • Experience working in a marketing function, ideally at a company in the $10-100mm of ARR range in enterprise software. 

  • Technical background and/or experience working on highly technical enterprise software products.

  • Ability to contribute at multiple scopes, from individual contribution to team management.

  • Experience leading, managing, and hiring teams.

Job Benefits

  • A remote-first work environment with semi-annual in-person meetups

  • Competitive pay

  • 100% employer-paid medical, dental, vision coverage for primary policyholders; 80% employer-paid coverage for eligible dependents.

  • 401(k) retirement plan with company match

  • Flexible vacation

  • Remote friendly perks such as snacks delivered monthly

  • Paid parental and family care leaves

  • Long term and short term disability

results.title: Growth/Demand Generation Manager
results.description:
At Eppo, we are building the future of AB experimentation, so that every company can have an entrepreneurial, customer oriented culture. We dramatically lower the overhead of running experiments by automating all of the experiment operations work that typically get pushed to analytics teams, and wrapping the results in collaborative workflows that give confidence in the results.

 

About the Role

We are hiring a Demand Generation Manager to partner closely with our Head of Product and Content Marketing. In this role you will be responsible for creating, executing, managing and optimizing our growth strategy. You will have a deep understanding of our audiences, and be able to look through data to determine direction and opportunities.

 

Your Background

This individual understands today’s MarTech ecosystem deeply, and has experience marketing tools to technical audiences. This individual has spent time in the marketing space and has a deep understanding of demand generation and growth for start-ups. Knowledge with data science and experimentation is a plus.

Attributes

  • Business owner mindset: you are comfortable making choices in ambiguous situations, and think of the team's success and failure as your own.

  • Organized: you have an appetite for organization and managing multiple workflows.

  • Communicator: you can communicate with stakeholders and customers and understand how to adjust to different ways of communication.

  • Curiosity: You are a lifelong learner, and are obsessed with understanding why customers act the way they do.

Skills

  • Facilitate and promote customer webinars and events to drive lead generation

  • Develop and execute multi-channel campaigns

  • Create and maintain lead and pipeline metrics (data collection, lead scoring, and analytics)

  • Create customer personas and gain a deep understanding of their buying persona

  • Strategize nurture campaigns to target consumers for various stages of the sales lifecycle

  • A growth mindset and strong accountability mentality

  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills

  • Expertise and organizational management skills to onboard vendors/contractors as needed

 

Compensation

  • Competitive salary and equity

  • Top of the line health, dental, and vision insurance

  • New laptop/equipment of your choice and whatever else you need to be productive

  • Compensation for learning materials, tools, and resources to help you learn and grow

results.title: Content Marketing Manager (Fintech)
results.description:
Solidgate is a B2B product in the field of online payments. We build “made in Ukraine” fintech solutions that help businesses accept payments and ensure a smooth purchase experience for their clients from Europe to LATAM, from the USA to Asia. We are part of the history of each company we work with — and we help them enter new markets and increase their profits. We believe no company should struggle with payments. So we make them easy.

Solidgate achievements:

  • offices in Ukraine, Poland, Cyprus
  • 200+ clients went global thanks to Solidgate (Ukraine, US, EU)
  • 100+ alternative payment methods (APMs)
  • 120 team members
  • PCI DSS Level 1 provider
  • № 1 employer (Ukrainian DOU version)

We're looking for a Content Marketing Manager who can help us tell the story of how the Solidgate product enables global businesses and builds the economic infrastructure for the internet economy. You will give a voice to our company over a range of channels and experiences and share knowledge about payments and technology across the industry.

Our advantages:

  • Fintech — fast-growing industry
  • Back-end driven product with complex logic, architecture, and modern stack (Golang, Java, Kotlin, React, Typescript, PostgreSQL, Elastic, Redis, RabbitMQ, Docker, AWS)
  • the opportunity to do business with large Western tech companies (USA, Europe)
  • challenges and direct impact on business scaling, on product metrics, here you can propose and implement
  • a team that burns with a common goal, has a common vision and values
  • opportunity for development and growth, personal career plan for each employee

You will:

  • interpret directive and technical information and turn it into creative and engaging copy for intended readers to build the case that Solidgate is the best payments solution for all of our target audience segments;
  • conduct in-depth research on industry-related topics in order to develop original content;
  • create content for Solidgate Blog (articles, news, lead magnets, etc.);
  • apply insights from user research to guide your ideas, and validate your solutions with user testing and analytics that help Solidgate stand out from the noise and engage new users otherwise wouldn't have reached.

You should have:

  • 3+ years experience in content marketing/ developing business content in the IT-sphere (fintech is a great plus);
  • pro of simple, concise and language as well as growth marketing copywriting best practices;
  • experience working on digital marketing collateral (Email, Facebook Ads, etc.);
  • creative mindset and strong communication skills;
  • deep understanding of the product development process;
  • basic understanding of SEO;
  • Advanced level of English (C1/C2).

​​Keep in mind, this is not only about writing text, it's also about metrics and promotion!

Feels like a perfect match already? Get in contact with us on LinkedIn:

Recruiter, Tania Baladynska / Telegram

Competitive corporate benefits:

  • health insurance and corporate doctor
  • free lunches in the office
  • full coverage of professional training (courses, meetups, certifications)
  • performance review twice a year
  • sports compensation
  • competitive salary
  • the ability to work remotely
  • Apple equipment
Hiring process:

Screening with a recruiter, an interview with a hiring manager, a test task and a final interview with the CEO.

If you want to become part of our team, send your resume right now and we will contact you.

results.title: Director of Demand Generation
results.description:
To Apply:

Please submit your application here https://hire.toggl.com/c/pq0v2/7vgjl/

  • Type: Contractor (full-time)
  • Work place: Anywhere (remote). This role will require you to work primarily during Eastern Time (GMT-4).
  • Compensation: $2,500-3,500 USD/month

About You

You are a strategic, visionary and hands-on Marketing Leader, with the ability to define and execute demand-generating strategies for a fast-growing company, while building a highly accountable team that sets targets and hits them consistently. You live, breathe, love and understand demand generation marketing for enterprise for a SaaS B2B platform. This role reports to the CEO and is a member of the leadership team.

Your Impact

  • Identify and fix holes in our sales funnel.
  • Develop compelling multi-channel marketing programs to support the demand generation needs of the sales team so they can consistently hit their SQL targets.
  • Work with the marketing team to develop, execute, promote and produce strong content-driven campaigns that resonate with our audience and help build awareness of our brand and product category.
  • Constantly test and analyze new marketing initiatives for continuous improvement.
  • Regularly analyze marketing and sales funnel data to optimize and focus marketing efforts on leads that drive the maximum sales results.
  • Manage all marketing contact lists and establish deep knowledge of our database of marketing leads to uncover where opportunities for engagement exist to generate qualified interest
  • Understand the needs of our target audience, and translate those needs into creative and personalized marketing programs

Our company

V2 Cloud is a fast growing tech company. We help businesses embrace remote work by providing a fully managed Desktop-as-a-Service solution from the Cloud. We are a young and dynamic team with an awesome product that serves over 900 clients and 35,000 users worldwide. More information at www.v2cloud.com

Our Vision is to "Help businesses create workplaces where people love to work."

Mission: "Create the best remote work experience for people and companies."

Our Values:

  • We enjoy our work, take pride in exceeding expectations and a job well done.
  • We get stuff done.
  • Keep It Simple & Smart
  • Life is too short to work with A**holes

We hire the people we trust, and we trust the people we hire. We value diversity of thought - Be bold enough to voice dissenting opinions.

Requirements

You will be measured on:

  • Revenue generation
  • Inbound opportunity creation
  • New user acquisition
  • Conversions and retention all the way through the flywheel
  • A mix of marketing, sales, and product qualified opportunities

What will you need?

  • Demonstrated experience of leading marketing teams and track-record of driving user growth at a B2B tech platform.
  • You have a proven track record of generating leads and pipeline via strategic digital marketing initiatives.
  • Comfortable owning the full marketing stack across product marketing, brand marketing, demand generation, content marketing, communications, and PR strategy.
  • Demonstrated ability in developing and executing GTM campaigns which are measurable, scalable, and cost-effective.
  • Expert analytical and quantitative skills with demonstrated ability to analyze data and translate to actionable changes and a history of demonstrating results via data-driven marketing campaigns.
  • Deep understanding of the SaaS B2B marketing environment and evolving tools/platforms used to improve online presence
  • Hands-on experience with CRM and SEO tools like Google Analytics, Google Adwords, Pardot, Hubspot, etc

If this sounds exciting, we'd love to hear from you! Not sure you’re a perfect fit? Reach out anyway. We’re looking for awesome individuals, not folks who perfectly match a job posting.

results.title: Product Marketing Manager
results.description:
Keboola is a versatile data operating system that enables companies to automate business actions using data and produce value. It is also flexible enough to be deployed in big enterprise stacks, thereby helping data teams work faster and smarter. Keboola lowers the barrier to entry for aspiring data teams and helps increase the productivity of data teams by reducing the complexity of the data stack, design, operation and maintenance. This leads to a better focus on the actual business value. 
 
Keboola’s success is built by innovation, and our remote-mainly team spread across offices in Prague, Vancouver, Chicago, greater Europe, and beyond. We believe that when people have a mission and a voice, their well-being and performance is better. Our environment stands for no BS and grants our people the ability to interact freely across teams connected by a passion for a culture of continuous learning while encompassing care, love, and respect. 
 
This position is best-suited for an experienced product marketer, who knows how to get shit done. Someone who is proactive, detail oriented and data-driven.
 
Regardless of the specifics of your background, you should be able to demonstrate:
-Consulting skills demonstrated by the ability to break down complex problems into pieces in an orderly way, understand their intricacies, and define a solution that your stakeholders will understand and want to adopt.
-Communication skills that include professional English and the skills to remain calm in a heated situation and focus on achieving an outcome that works for all parties involved.
-Problem-solving and analytical skills across a wide array of tools. You can easily switch between brainstorming a process improvement on a whiteboard and developing a weighted-average cash-in prediction model.



What you'll do
  • Support and activate global go-to-market strategies for new and updated product releases including internal and external collateral development, sales training, customer communication and messaging.
  • Develop and deliver end-to-end integrated go-to-market & communications plans for product launches.
  • Work closely with product and Dev teams to guide strategy, timing of launch, target audience and local needs, and the launch communication and success criteria.
  • Design and improve processes that will help us scale activities across the region while reflecting local specifics.
  • Develop customer campaigns to optimize adoption of current and new features, in partnership with the Product team. 
  • Be the owner of all product marketing content, such as product documentation, videos, webinars, presentations, sales sheets and blog posts.
  • Work with the Sales and Product team on creation of product training and product enablement materials.



The skills and experience you need to have
  • 5+ years of experience working in technology field, preferably SaaS
  • Proven experience on a similar role
  • Data-oriented person
  • Used to collaborating with teams across the company
  • Passionate about technology
  • Fluent in English



A little bit more about the opportunity
  • Autonomy within your position. We are focused on outcomes, not micromanaging everything that you do. We love free company movement.
  • Work with great brands both locally and worldwide. Ask us who we are working with!
  • Work with new industry-leading data technologies.
  • The opportunity to create the job you want that fits in with the life you want. We know there is life outside of work, and think fulfillment is achieved when all areas of your life fit together.
  • We believe the best people are a bit weird and have an inner engine that drives them. 



You can look forward to the following benefits
  • Competitive compensation, bonuses and Stock options.
  • Generous paid vacation time.  And we mean generous.
  • Cool new offices in the heart of Holesovice in Prague.
  • We are a company born in the cloud means we are relatively location independent. Want to take an extra-long trip while working on the beach (or forest, or desert?), go ahead - make sure to send us a postcard. 
  • No set office hours and flexible work environment.
Keboola’s Philosophies and Values
CARE, LOVE AND RESPECT
CREATE AND INNOVATE
GET YOUR STUFF DONE
LEARN
ONE TEAM
NO BULLSHIT
 
Come One, Come All
Keboola provides equal employment opportunities to all employees, consultants, and applicants for employment. We do not discriminate on any basis. Here’s the thing: we don’t care what color you are, who you pray to, what gender you identify with, if you have tattoos or your hair is blue. We hire based on skill and culture fit. It really is that simple.
 
More About Keboola
Every day Keboola connects data, systems, and people to do their best work all in one place. Keboola is a hybrid, multi-cloud data platform that reduces your day-to-day complexity with data by streamlining and automating your data processes and systems, creating a scalable data structure that works best for you, and aligns business and IT in a secure environment so they can do meaningful work together. Hundreds of innovative companies use Keboola to unlock their data-driven power. The company has offices in Chicago, Vancouver, London, and Prague. For more information, connect with us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook or visit keboola.com.

results.title: Paid Social Media Strategist (Facebook/Instagram)
results.description:
The Strategist at JUICE is responsible for the health of the partnership and relationship for the client accounts in which they will serve as the primary POC. A Strategist will manage Senior Buyers and Buyers within their POD and be an individual who can strategize, executive, optimize, and drive performance in accounts.

 

About us:

JUICE is a digital growth & marketing agency founded by two entrepreneurs with successful previous exits. Our strict focus on maximizing ROI has helped our clients see enormous revenue-driving success across user acquisition, eCommerce, and lead generation campaigns. JUICE is an Inc. 5000 award-winning industry leader in results-driven growth strategy development, social advertising, search engine marketing, organic search ranking, and lead generation. JUICE focuses on building scalable, efficient campaigns that drive results.

 

What you’ll do:

  • Be the primary point of contact for the clients the strategist has been assigned to.
  • Strategize, execute, and manage a portfolio of client-paid social ad campaigns
  • Develop marketing strategies and create clear plans to achieve client business goals.
  • Design funnels with a thorough understanding of LTV and CAC, not just the initial acquisition of new customers/users.
  • Serve as a leader in the company by clearly communicating strategy, performance, and campaign recommendations externally and internally
  • Delegate efficiently and productively to junior team members in order to ensure client deliverables and performance targets are being adhered to
  • A seasoned understanding of performance digital marketing metrics for our clients with the ability to analyze performance, identify areas for improvement and justify campaign decisions to clients and internal JUICE stakeholders.
  • Have the ability to self-conduct, gather and analyze market research to determine social media opportunities and competitiveness.
  • Be an exemplary model of JUICE values

 

What you’ll need to succeed:

  • 3+ years of paid Facebook advertising experience, building high-converting funnels and driving quantifiable results.
  • 3+ years managing paid social media advertising clients
  • Strong understanding of advertising and marketing principles, particularly for online audiences.
  • Expertise in conceiving, testing, and optimizing ad copy.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Proven ability to be proactive.
  • Ability to think critically.
  • A passion for growing businesses.

 

What you’ll find here:

  • Competitive salary based on experience level.
  • Awesome, energetic work environment.
  • Annual offsite.
  • Lunch & Learns.
  • Matching 401k plan.
  • Health benefits.
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Fully Remote Work.

results.title: Digital Public Relations - Social Media Specialist
results.description:
Company Description

Forbes Advisor is a new initiative for consumers under the Forbes Marketplace umbrella that provides journalist- and expert-written insights, news and reviews on all things personal finance.

We’re dedicated to helping turn aspirations into reality. We do this by providing consumers with the knowledge and research they need to make informed financial decisions they can feel confident in, so they can get back to doing the things they care about most.



Job Description

Forbes Advisor is looking for a Social Media Specialist to join its growing Digital Public Relations (DPR) team within Forbes Marketplace, North America. You’ll be responsible for running the Forbes Advisor social media accounts with a keen focus on engagement with key members of the media, influencers, and readers.

Responsibilities: 

  • Manage Forbes Advisor’s core social media accounts with a keen focus on media engagement. 
  • Work with DPR and Editorial teams to determine best content to share across platforms. 
  • Produce performance reports; share learnings across teams. 
  • Ideate and execute strategies to extend the visibility of our key Editors and experts. 
  • Ability to pivot tactics to meet business objectives as needed. 

 

Requirements: 

  • 2-3 years of relevant social media experience.
  • We’re looking for fast learners that are full of enthusiasm and creative ideas.
  • Detail-oriented with the ability to work quickly and efficiently.
  • Ability to multitask and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
  • Speak, write and edit succinctly and compellingly.
  • Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering clear and precise work is a must.
  • Strong organizational skills and willingness to work on a variety of projects.



Qualifications



Additional Information

Forbes Marketplace provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

#LI-REMOTE #LI-NM1

 

Forbes Marketplace provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
